alert.note: Alert for Edgar (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 9:17PM CDT until March 31 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southern Edgar County in east central Illinois... * Until 930 PM CDT. * At 917 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over mainly rural areas of Edgar County, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Paris around 925 PM CDT. Vermilion around 930 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
